docs.lead_paragraph: Warning: What you are about to read may contain Democratic delusions. Democrats on Capitol Hill and at the White House are whispering about a long-shot way to pass health legislation before the end of the year.
docs.abstract: Prescriptions blog on possible Democratic strategy for long-shot attempt to pass health care reform legislation by end of year (M)
docs.snippet: Warning: What you are about to read may contain Democratic delusions.      Democrats on Capitol Hill and at the White House are whispering about a long-shot way to pass health legislation before the end of the year.

docs.lead_paragraph: Economists say that one of the most important pieces of health care reform is an independent commission to help set Medicare payment rates. The best hope for creating a serious version of such a commission may be Senator John D. Rockefeller IV, the West Virginia Democrat.

headline.main: Rockefeller: The Economists' Man in the Senate?

docs.abstract: Will health reform include an independent Medicare commission worthy of the name?
docs.snippet: Will health reform include an independent Medicare commission worthy of the name?

docs.lead_paragraph: The majority leader, Harry Reid of Nevada, refused on Tuesday night to provide any details about the preliminary agreement among a group of 10 Democratic senators to resolve a bitter dispute over a proposed government-run insurance plan, or "public option."
docs.abstract: A few weeks ago, the Senate majority leader, Harry Reid, trumpeted with great fanfare his support for a government-run insurance plan. Now, he has embraced a deal that would effectively remove it from the health care bill. But that may have been in the cards all along.
docs.snippet: A few weeks ago, the Senate majority leader, Harry Reid, trumpeted with great fanfare his support for a government-run insurance plan. Now, he has embraced a deal that would effectively remove it from the health care bill. But that may have been in...

headline.main: Senate Leaders in Tentative Deal to Alter Public Option

docs.abstract: The Senate votes against adding tougher abortion insurance restrictions to the health care bill.
docs.snippet: The Senate votes against adding tougher abortion insurance restrictions to the health care bill.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ROBERT PEAR

docs.lead_paragraph: With everybody watching what the Senate is doing on the health care legislation, the House of Representatives might have been feeling a little left out since it passed its 1,990-page bill on Nov. 7.

headline.main: Cross Talk in House Hearing on Drug Prices

docs.abstract: Some House members still have something to say about health care -- and they said it in a hearing on drug prices.
docs.snippet: Some House members still have something to say about health care -- and they said it in a hearing on drug prices.

docs.lead_paragraph: Warning: what you are about to read may contain Democratic delusions.
docs.abstract: Democrats are whispering about an unlikely legislative maneuver that could move a health care bill to the White House in short order.
docs.snippet: Democrats are whispering about an unlikely legislative maneuver that could move a health care bill to the White House in short order.

docs.lead_paragraph: With the insurance lobby hammering hard, and while scores of nonprofit and advocacy groups representing the elderly and the disabled held their collective breath, the Class Act last week narrowly survived a move to strip it from the Senate's health care legislation. (The vote is here.)

headline.main: The Class Act Survives, for Now

docs.abstract: Senator Edward M. Kennedy's Class Act, which would create a government insurance program for long-term care, remains in both the House and Senate health care bills.
docs.snippet: Senator Edward M. Kennedy's Class Act, which would create a government insurance program for long-term care, remains in both the House and Senate health care bills.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two important issues - medical cost-containment measures and insurance coverage for abortions - will be at center stage on the Senate floor on Tuesday. And each in its way is vital to the fate of the Democrats' big health care legislation.

headline.main: Prescriptions: The Latest on the Senate Debate Over Health Care

docs.abstract: Medical cost-containment measures and insurance coverage for abortions - will be at center stage on the Senate floor on Tuesday.
docs.snippet: Medical cost-containment measures and insurance coverage for abortions - will be at center stage on the Senate floor on Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two important issues -- medical cost-containment measures and insurance coverage for abortions -- will be at center stage on the Senate floor on Tuesday. And each in its way is vital to the fate of the Democrats' big health care legislation.

headline.main: Abortion and Costs at Top of Senate Agenda

docs.abstract: Two issues potentially crucial to the fate of the Senate health bill -- insurance coverage for abortions, and medical cost containment -- will be at center stage on the Senate floor Tuesday.
docs.snippet: Two issues potentially crucial to the fate of the Senate health bill -- insurance coverage for abortions, and medical cost containment -- will be at center stage on the Senate floor Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A wide variety of consumer-focused stories appears in various sections of The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them all up here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.
